result.execSummary:
The defendant Mallory Ann Pooler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Compulsory School Attendance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 118.15(1)(a).
  • Compulsory School Attendance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 118.15(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mallory Ann Pooler

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation

Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

As to COUNTS 3 and 4:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 11 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs and fees by 03-27-2019, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Court waives all non-mandatory court costs and fees due to defendant's income. 

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Based upon speedy dispo request and Br. 33 being down, case removed from DPA court and reassigned via succession back to original misdemeanor court.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court order Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Speedy disposition enter, due to Branch 33 court being down this case will be assigned to Branch 24 for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2018 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant was in a car accident and was injured.  Defendant was UNABLE to attend today's hearing due to injury.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for January 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Community Conferencing will not be held by the DA's Office as the minor child(ren) are no longer placed within the home.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court took note of the improved attendance.  Defense advised that the minor child(ren) have not been residing with the Defendant since OCTOBER 2016.  Defendant has NOT started the Community Conferencing as of this hearing.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to complete Community Servce OR Community Conferencing.  Defendant to complete the Parenting class.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.
DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.

Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Rael on behalf of Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Review Hearing. Defendant contacted another court. Message relayed that, defendant is ill and will not be able to appear today. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case calendared for Review Hearing on 5/31/2016 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Both Counts:

 Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Violation Report of missed office contact, received and filed
Court takes no action at this time.

Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea/DPAH   in Branch 47  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defendant Mallory Ann Pooler not in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
